items.title: Delay in disallowed Semenyo goal an 'edge case'
items.summary: The delay in ruling out a Manchester City goal for offside in Tuesday's Carabao Cup win at Newcastle was extended because semi-automated offside technology could not be used in the incident.

items.title: Man City sign USWNT's Coffey from Thorns
items.summary: Manchester City have announced the signing of United States midfielder Sam Coffey from NWSL side Portland Thorns.

items.title: Police on ban of Maccabi fans: AI was to blame
items.summary: West Midlands Police's chief constable has apologised to MPs for giving them an error in evidence over the decision to ban Maccabi Tel Aviv fans.

items.title: Sources: Utd not planning Jan. transfers for Carrick
items.summary: Michael Carrick will work with the squad he has inherited as Man United boss with the club having no plans to make new signings, sources have told ESPN.

items.title: FC Bankzaken: toekomst Vitesse blijft vaag en onzeker
items.summary: In de serie FC Bankzaken bespreekt Tom Knipping samen met presentator Bart Frouws de financi√´n in het binnen- en buitenlandse voetbal. In deze aflevering gaan de heren dieper in op de financi√´le situatie van Vitesse.

items.title: Het plan dat Ajax heeft voor Ibrahimovic Junior
items.summary: Ruim 21 jaar na het vertrek van Zlatan heeft Ajax weer een Ibrahimovic in de gelederen. Maximilian Ibrahimovic (19) komt op huurbasis over van AC Milan, met de kans om een meerjarig contract te verdienen in Amsterdam. Wat kunnen beide partijen van elkaar verwachten?

items.title: Premier League's top 50 transfers of all time: Who will be No. 1?
items.summary: What makes a great signing? Is it trophies won, goals scored, a long run of dominance ... or all of the above? Bill Connelly breaks down the best 50 Premier League moves since it began in 1992-93.

items.title: Spurs sporting director Paratici to join Fiorentina
items.summary: Tottenham's joint sporting director Fabio Paratici is to leave the club and join Fiorentina following the end of the January transfer window, three months after returning to the club.

items.title: 'Olympique Marseille ziet komst El Karouani wel zitten'
items.summary: De winterse transfermarkt is geopend. In dit blog vind je alle speculaties en bevestigde transfers in Nederland. Bekijk hier ons blog voor de transferperikelen in het buitenland.

items.title: Palace latest: Eagles in talks to sign Ligue 1 forward
Manchester City sign USA midfielder Coffey
items.summary: Manchester City have signed United States midfielder Sam Coffey from Portland Thorns on a three-and-a-half-year contract.

items.title: Flick is op z'n hoede voor Santander en geniet na van Cl√°sico-zege
items.summary: Barcelona-trainer Hansi Flick waakt voor onderschatting op weg naar de Copa del Rey-wedstrijd tegen Racing Santander. De Duitser toonde zich in aanloop naar het bekerduel complimenteus over de koploper in de Segunda Divisi√≥n en kwam nog terug op de Cl√°sico van zondag .

items.title: Waarom Ten Hag zijn vertrek bij Leverkusen na drie weken achter zich liet
items.summary: Het kostte Erik ten Hag drie weken om zijn vertrek bij Bayer Leverkusen te verwerken. De nieuwe technisch directeur van FC Twente vindt dat hij niet de kans heeft gekregen om resultaten te halen. 'Dan houdt alles op en moet je het achter je laten.'

items.title: Woods: Koepka's return to PGA Tour from LIV a 'win for everyone'
items.summary: Tiger Woods said Brooks Koepka's return to the PGA Tour makes it "a better place to play" and is a "win for everyone".

items.title: Rangers agree loan for Wolfsburg winger Skov Olsen
items.summary: Rangers have agreed a loan deal for Wolfsburg winger Andreas Skov Olsen.

items.title: Woods reveals injury 'progress' update during TGL appearance
'We're really stretched' - Livramento blow adds to Newcastle defence concerns
items.summary: Head coach Eddie Howe admits Newcastle United are "really stretched" after Tino Livramento is ruled out for up to two months with a hamstring injury.

items.title: Pro Licence admission barriers allow women‚Äôs coaching opportunities to go ‚Äòdown the drain‚Äô
items.summary: Uefa‚Äôs limitations have set hurdles for women keen to take the next step in coaching despite the increasing demand Mariana Cabral has a coaching CV to be proud of. Born on the small Azores island of S√£o Miguel, she has been in charge of the women‚Äôs teams at clubs including Benfica and Sporting, but the 38-year-old is frustrated. ‚ÄúWe want more women coaches,‚Äù she says. ‚ÄúWho won the Euros? Who won the Champions League? Women ‚Äì but we are losing so many.‚Äù Cabral has her A Licence but is stuck in limbo. Unable to get on a Pro Licence course that would clear a path to more senior head coach roles in an era when women‚Äôs teams are increasingly demanding that qualification, she stepped back to become a No 2 in the US. But after one NWSL season with Utah Royals, she left in December in the hope that expanding her experience at another club would help to open a Pro Licence door. Continue reading...

items.title: Iran‚Äôs footballers face battle to be heard as regime brutally clamps down on protests
items.summary: For Mehdi Taremi and others playing abroad, showing solidarity with their home nation can mean threats and possible detention Mehdi Taremi did what he does best. On Saturday, the Iranian striker turned inside the area and scored for Olympiakos, a well-taken eighth goal of the season for the 33-year-old that clinched a 2-0 win at Atromitos and a place at the top of the Greek Super League. Usually, millions of people in Iran follow every step of Taremi‚Äôs European career, one that took off with Porto and has settled in Piraeus via Milan, but not this time. The ruling regime in Tehran has cut the internet and all communications, which meant that residents of the football-loving nation also missed the non-celebration that followed. ‚ÄúIt actually has to do with the conditions in my country,‚Äù Taremi said. ‚ÄúThere are problems between the people and the government. The people are always with us, and that‚Äôs why we are with them. I couldn‚Äôt celebrate in solidarity with the Iranian people. I know that Olympiakos fans would like me to be happy, but I don‚Äôt celebrate the goals, in solidarity with what the Iranian people are going through.‚Äù Continue reading...

items.title: Football transfer rumours: Chelsea to swoop for West Ham‚Äôs Lucas Paquet√°?
items.summary: Today‚Äôs tell-all has got its ducks in a row Liam Rosenior has been Chelsea manager for a whole week without making a signing. That is bound to be remedied soon enough, and one name that has been bandied about is that of Lucas Paquet√°. The Brazilian midfielder is set to leave West Ham in this transfer window having has said he wants to leave the Premier League and join Flamengo because of his disillusionment with how he was treated over the spot-fixing allegations of which he was cleared. But the Brazilian journalist Renan Moura reports that people around Paquet√° want to persuade him to stay in Europe, and Chelsea could move for him. The future of Marc Gu√©hi was always likely to be one of the main plotlines of this transfer window, with original suitors Liverpool tussling with Manchester City over the defender‚Äôs services as he enters the last six months of his Crystal Palace contract. Arsenal have also shown interest but now entering stage left are Bayern Munich, whose sporting director, Max Erbl, has been having cosy chats with Gu√©hi‚Äôs agent at the Bundesliga champions‚Äô training ground, according to Sky Italia. Continue reading...
